channel.title: Which is the Superior web browser
channel.description:
Firefox, Google Chrome or IE 8.
PS. I know IE won't win, but why not.
I say firefox because of the add ons.

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser

item.description:

opera 10

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

fellixombc:

I’d say, any browser besides IE is decent. IE, imo, is a very slow piece of shit. Firefox starts faster, but I have no proof showing so. I just use firefox anyways, custom themes, plug-ins, etc.

firefox takes at least 8 seconds to start for me
(i have to use firefox preloader, which cuts it to 1 or 2)

and ye its probably my computer just sucking, but theres no excuse for such long startup times. especially when opera always starts up instantly for me

Read full topic

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Opera is so superior? Then why the hell can’t it use the 64bit java plugin? Phail.

Also the way Opera manages rss feeds royally sucks imo

I like Firefox’s setup for rss 10x better.

Although from what I can tell I think that Opera 10 “feels” somewhat faster when I’m browsing with it as opposed to firefox. I’m saying that with Turbo disabled, it still feels faster.

I’m sticking with Firefox.

Read full topic
item.source: Which is the Superior web browser

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Firefox crashes all the time for me, Chrome does so rarely. What I really like about Chrome is that it doesn’t come with features that I’ll never use like Firefox does. For linux I use Lynx/Firefox but for windows almost always Chrome.

Read full topic

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:299584”][quote author=mago cash link=topic=395899.msg2941809#msg2941809 date=1251932037]
I haven’t tried Opera my self, but I must say I’ve been hearing some really good feedback. I still dislike the name.
[/quote]

Every time a new version of Opera comes out, I hear good things, I install it, use it, hate it, then remove it.

edit:
Hate isn’t fair, I just like Firefox far more. Miss my plugins etc.[/quote]
Cuz you use it thinking: fucking this closed source crap. No wonder you hate it.

item.description:
@mago_cash wrote:

If you say Chrome is fast, Chrome is just like IE, poor page and image loading; some one compare the speed of the following browsers Google Chrome vs FireFox vs Opera (Gay name).

I haven’t tried Opera my self, but I must say I’ve been hearing some really good feedback. I still dislike the name.

To cut it short, Firefox is better than Opera.

item.source: Which is the Superior web browser

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:21, topic:299584”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=395899.msg2941361#msg2941361 date=1251911650]

  1. You don’t know if it is secure or not, you don’t have the source.

  2. It isn’t, you don’t have the source.

  3. Good if you like those, I don’t want UserJS, MouseGestures, Speeddial, and if I ever did, I would install the firefox plugin for them. Opera decides what I need and want in a browser? I don’t think so, I want a browser that comes with a minimum (tabs for example) and anything extra I want I install.

  4. Less secure, how do they have more control than Mozilla? it’s not like they let anyone check in code.

  5. As opposed to being a feature, that is a lack of a feature. And indeed, is controlled by the text editor.
    [/quote]

  6. Secunia or someshit. Useless comparing right now since Opera 10 just got released yesterday

  7. How is it not? They compiled it for a shitload of platforms, and provide builds for mobile phones and platforms like DS and Wii.

  8. Great thing is: If I don’t want to use the mail client for example, it won’t take memory. Whereas it probably would in firefox, since it’s an extension.

  9. They got more control over what happens with the browser, anyone could put a virus or someshit in firefox and claim its the real deal.

  10. Can’t really say anything about that, but 90% of the time I don’t want to copy the formatting.[/quote]

  11. Some company runs some tests and says it is secure, they also run those same tests on firefox and say it is secure. The difference? billions of people, including yourself, can check the mozilla source code to see if it really is secure or not, and if it isn’t, it is immediately fixed.

  12. Only because they made a deal with nintendo, if the Wii and DS SDK was open there would be firefox builds as well. If you want firefox for another platform, you can compile it yourself, if you want opera, too bad. So firefox is better at cross-platform.

  13. No, it would be the same as an extension. If you aren’t using it, it isn’t taking memory. The ability to have only what you want is the main selling point of firefox. (offtopic: a mail client built into opera? WHY!!! If I wanted a mail client, I’d download one (thunderbird))

  14. Refer to Unhandled’s post above.

Read full topic
item.source: Which is the Superior web browser

[/quote]
4. They got more control over what happens with the browser, anyone could put a virus or someshit in firefox and claim its the real deal.[/quote]
Can you not read? it’s not like they let anyone check in code.

Read full topic

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Sorry but Firefox rapes IE. I’ve been using Google Chrome for a while, its fast but im used to all my add ons with firefox. Recently its been getting really slow, its eating 100% of my cpu constantly, noming on my ram like a fat bitch eating chocloate and it keeps crashing! I love firefox for the add ons and google chrome for the speed.

Read full topic
item.source: Which is the Superior web browser

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:18, topic:299584”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=395899.msg2941463#msg2941463 date=1251918285]
Developing software is not free, someone has to pay for it. So they not need to make their product hard to use so people would use money on support (Like Linux distros, not misunderstand it is great but have much again to beat the userfriendliness of Windows.).
[/quote]
You are so misinformed about software development it isn’t even funny.[/quote]
Manpower is not free, someone has to pay, few uses lots of their time in a job they don’t earn money on.

For normal use Opera is best, but have you some specific needs Firefox may be the right browser for you.

Read full topic
item.source: Which is the Superior web browser

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:299584”]1. You don’t know if it is secure or not, you don’t have the source.
2. It isn’t, you don’t have the source.
3. Good if you like those, I don’t want UserJS, MouseGestures, Speeddial, and if I ever did, I would install the firefox plugin for them. Opera decides what I need and want in a browser? I don’t think so, I want a browser that comes with a minimum (tabs for example) and anything extra I want I install.
4. Less secure, how do they have more control than Mozilla? it’s not like they let anyone check in code.
5. As opposed to being a feature, that is a lack of a feature. And indeed, is controlled by the text editor.[/quote]

  1. Secunia or someshit. Useless comparing right now since Opera 10 just got released yesterday
  2. How is it not? They compiled it for a shitload of platforms, and provide builds for mobile phones and platforms like DS and Wii.
  3. Great thing is: If I don’t want to use the mail client for example, it won’t take memory. Whereas it probably would in firefox, since it’s an extension.
  4. They got more control over what happens with the browser, anyone could put a virus or someshit in firefox and claim its the real deal.
  5. Can’t really say anything about that, but 90% of the time I don’t want to copy the formatting.

Read full topic

item.title: Which is the Superior web browser
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

Chrome > Opera > FF > IE

Chrome is just so lightweight and clean… FF’s plugins are useful sometimes but I would only use one or two which aren’t really worth switching

[quote=“Niall, post:9, topic:299584”][quote author=cane link=topic=395899.msg2941044#msg2941044 date=1251880782]

Firefox, Google Chrome or IE 8.

PS. I know IE won’t win, but why not.

I say firefox because of the add ons.

The only reason that IE wont win is because who you are asking this question at.
[/quote]

No, because it is inferior.[/quote]

Like most of the world

Read full topic
